duration_raw: until the next time you make your daily preparations
markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 5" pfs="">[Blind Eye](/Spells.aspx?ID=1213)</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 78</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>

<row>1 minute ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the next time you make your daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You enchant a single object, preventing it from being used for magical observation. If you cast this spell on a non-magical item used to cast scrying spells, such as a [spell component pouch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=33) or a spell focus, the item can't be used to cast the spell. If you cast _blind eye_ on a magical item that can be activated to scry (such as a [_crystal ball_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=253) or [_hag eye_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=935)), the item can't be activated for scrying effects. Magical items that are twice _blind eye's_ spell level or more aren't blocked this way.
name: Blind Eye

summary: You enchant a single object, preventing it from being used for magical observation.
summary_markdown: You enchant a single object, preventing it from being used for magical observation.
text: Blind Eye May contain spoilers from Blood Lords Source Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw pg. 78 Traditions Arcane, Occult Cast 1 minute (material, somatic, verbal) Range touch Target 1 object Duration until the next time you make your daily preparations --- You enchant a single object, preventing it from being used for magical observation. If you cast this spell on a non-magical item used to cast scrying spells, such as a spell component pouch or a spell focus, the item can't be used to cast the spell. If you cast blind eye on a magical item that can be activated to scry (such as a crystal ball or hag eye ), the item can't be activated for scrying effects. Magical items that are twice blind eye's spell level or more aren't blocked this way.
